column1: It's been an honor to serve alongside Democratic Whip @ClyburnSC06 in the fight against the coronavirus. He's here virtually to remind us that the best day to vote is today and that this may be the most important election in 150 years. Take it from him - he knows his history. https://t.co/DSmPfoNtbR

No matter what happens on Nov 3rd can we all promise that when Mike Pence runs for president in 2024 we not forget that he ran the Coronavirus task force that failed our nation?  https://t.co/atvXOgiPqe

The @BurlcoTimes asked me recently what our community's greatest need is right now. I told them we need to address COVID-19 defend our health care and preexisting condition protections and rebuild our economy. Read my full answer here:  https://t.co/OZDSv5sx4m

This week I had the chance to visit Ocean Health Initiatives and thank them for the incredible work they do. From providing affordable health care to those at all income levels to testing tens of thousands for COVID @ohinj has been a lifeline for our community. https://t.co/okPZ206K2x

Use the coronavirus as a litmus test for leadership. Ask yourself: In this race who is responsible and who is the radical? Vote Andy Kim for Congress by far the safest choice.   Thank you @njdotcom for your endorsement.   https://t.co/FlcAwV1iYm

This morning I joined @MSNBC with @AliVelshi to discuss what the coronavirus outbreak in the WH means for our national security and the lessons we should learn from it. This must be a unifying moment where we rededicate ourselves to the science that will help us beat this virus. https://t.co/AUR6mMd4GN

I'm in DC today pushing for another coronavirus relief package but I'm thinking about the time I spent in Cinnaminson and Delran recently. Hearing from those business owners is guiding my push for easier PPP forgiveness less red tape and more critical state and local funding. https://t.co/exXx548Pf4

Thank you to everyone who joined our Seniors for Andy round table this morning! I was happy to discuss how we can protect our Social Security and Medicare what we're doing in the fight against the coronavirus and everything we need to do to win between now and election day. https://t.co/GYVrunadmR

As one of only 7 House Democrats charged with leading our nation's coronavirus response I've worked tirelessly to gather the facts on where we are and where we need to go. Today I released a report titled outlining how we can stay ahead of this virus.   https://t.co/N6IfxZsvbu

The only bosses I have are the people of our community which is why it's so important I get out listen and talk about what's going on in Congress. I spent today in DC working on coronavirus relief but I'm always guided by conversations like this one I had just a few days ago. https://t.co/PMSWufS9ku

In Bordentown what I heard from every small business owner was praise for their city government's coronavirus response. Hearing about leadership that was responsive flexible and innovative was a breath of fresh air before I went back to DC to keep fighting for our community. https://t.co/KhlwOQVXyj
Christine from Berkeley Township said "I rely on the Postal Service to get the prescriptions I need especially during the coronavirus pandemic."

Masks are our best front line defense against the coronavirus pandemic. That's why I was proud to work with allies in the Korean American community to secure and donate more than 6500 masks to @OceanCountyYMCA and 21 Plus this week.  https://t.co/Fpbs2dEqWX

As cases in Burlington County remain elevated please remember to wear a mask social distance and wash your hands as much as possible. We've made so much progress but we need to stay as diligent as ever.   https://t.co/SDBwNo2kSm

Today I got to walk through Toms River and talk with a few small business owners. I’m inspired by the work they’re doing for our community and how they’re adapting to doing business during coronavirus. Over the next few days I’ll be telling their stories here. https://t.co/FrYHlPu17C

We have a long way to go and we've lost far too many lives but this is a testament to the work we're doing here in Jersey. Stay safe wear a mask and social distance. We will get through this. https://t.co/UY0CGmxIdz

I’m proud to stand with @AFSCME in their fight for fairness prosperity and opportunity for all working families. AFSCME members have been on the front lines of our community in the fight against the coronavirus and I’m doing everything I can in Congress to work for them. https://t.co/Xoci3nPYRd

I’m honored to receive the endorsement of the @transportworker Union a historic union that has been on the front line in the fight for better pay and safety and equality in the workplace especially during the Coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/vfzmgK4VWm

I’ve been working for our seniors every day by fighting to lower prescription drug costs and expand Medicare benefits increase testing and PPE availability during the coronavirus pandemic and ensure access to direct relief payments.

I believe in a transparent government. Citizens have the right to know where our tax dollars have gone. If you are interested in where the Coronavirus PPP loans have gone check out this article:  https://t.co/y8OiCe7aUD

“We are living in the era of the coronavirus which is devastating to small business... Congressman Kim’s record when it comes to helping small businesses during this era is outstanding.”  I'm proud to fight every day for our small businesses.   https://t.co/XB3tRRBbhW

Tomorrow I’ll be joining this incredibly important and timely conversation on how the coronavirus has exposed and intensified racial inequities in America. We’ll discuss how we got here and where the fight for justice can take us. I hope you’ll tune in. https://t.co/drSfVytBko

Coronavirus is a national security crisis. Leading during times like these is about being able to share with people where we’re going what we’re going to be trying to achieve. I’m working to ensure when we reopen we do it safely effectively and permanently. @POLITICOLive https://t.co/R4Nn9mfHEu

The coronavirus has threatened our lives in immeasurable ways. Yet in the midst of a pandemic Washington Republicans continue their fight to strike down the Affordable Care Act and pre-existing condition protections. I will fight every day to prevent this from happening. https://t.co/Vxcg13CwdL

In times like these no one should have to fear scammers or false and misleading information. We’ve put together a few ways to avoid COVID-19 scams so that everyone in Burlington Ocean and around the country can stay as safe and healthy as possible during this crisis. https://t.co/JENxAVMzqJ

I’m honored to now serve as a member of the bipartisan Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis where I can fight to fix our nation’s response to this epidemic and be better prepared for the next one.  https://t.co/QN0k2JYtpp

I'm really proud of the work our volunteers have been doing recently checking in on our neighbors in senior communities across Burlington & Ocean Counties. We're making sure they have information & resources about COVID-19 and offering a (virtual) helping hand where we can. https://t.co/6Abn886nNF

I'm proud to stand with @PhilMurphyNJ to fight to bring more federal resources to NJ to battle Coronavirus & make it safe for people to get back to work. These are trying times but we're going to get through this together. See my remarks at minute 29:00. https://t.co/n5HfJ0YA9n

Today at 1:00pm I'll be joining @GovMurphy for his daily press briefing on COVID-19. Over the last couple months I've talked with people all over Burlington and Ocean Counties and your stories and your needs are what I'll be carrying with me today. https://t.co/Facuhlh6ky

I'm proud of the people communities and businesses that have been able to step up and switch gears to work together and provide much needed resources to #NJ. Together we will make it through. #COVID19 https://t.co/fg63XRDK4u https://t.co/eVqsiXoxnr

On this #nationaldoctorsday we are grateful more than ever for the physicians nurses and healthcare professionals who are working tirelessly on the frontline to help fight #COVID19. We are with you we support you and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

$2T emergency relief passed in the Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act. Including a State & Local Relief Fund Expanded Unemployment Benefits Small Business Relief & $200B for Our Hospitals Health Care Workers & Health Research.✅ https://t.co/GE6N2gJepK

As a nation this is a time where we must take care of one another. The American Red Cross is reporting a severe blood shortage due to coronavirus-related blood drive cancelations. Please share your good health! https://t.co/gGGRit2mfr

Small businesses have been hit hard by mandatory closures and safety measures required to slow the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19).   But businesses have a growing number of resources and relief programs to turn to at the federal and state level.  https://t.co/4daGtV0iB7

To receive the latest updates about COVID-19 the CDC's website is a helpful resource.    If you have general questions about COVID-19 or need resources the state of New Jersey is requesting that people dial 211.

Last Saturday I worked with my colleagues in Congress to find an agreement on the Families First Coronavirus Response Act to support these goals. We are working on emergency legislation right now to help provide you and your family with relief.

Today we announced that we will postpone our 2020 campaign kickoff rally scheduled for this Saturday in response to the current State of Emergency declared by the New Jersey government caused by the Coronavirus outbreak.
